page.title: 16WHITEMOOR RESERVOIR
page.content: Before the dam was constructed the area now under water was very boggy with 3 small streams/springs meeting to form a larger stream called {County {Brook,}this being the original {Lancashire - Yorkshire Border.}The vitrified stumps of large trees can be seen today in late summer when the water level has fallen. The reservoir was constructed by 1840 to store water for controlled release through sluices into County Brook and then into the canal to compensate for large traffic through the locks at{Barnoldswick}one side and the 7 locks at{Barrowford}on the other. The locks at Barrowford drop the canal over 33 feet, the largest change in level over the whole canal, hence the need fer 6 local reservoirs to hold a good head of water for the dry periods of summer.
